description: llvm-lipo - LLVM tool for manipulating universal binaries

global_flags.description: a single input file and display the architectures present in the file. Each architecture is separated by a single white‐ space. Unknown architectures are displayed as un‐ known(CPUtype,CPUsubtype).
at least one input file and require the output flag to be specified. Output a universal binary combining the input files.
Create a universal output file containing only the specified arch_type from the fat input file. Requires -output option

Take at least one input file and display the descriptions of each file. The descriptions include the filename and architec‐ ture types separated by whitespace. Universal binaries are grouped together first, followed by thin files. Architectures
Create output file with specified name

The replace flag is followed by an archi‐ tecture type, and a thin input file. Output a universal binary with the specified architecture slice in the universal binary input replaced with the contents of the thin input file.

and replace. The segalign flag is followed by an architecture type, and an alignment. The alignment is a hexadecimal number that is a power of 2. Output a file in which the slice with the specified architecture has the specified alignment.
Take a single universal binary input file and the thin flag fol‐ lowed by an architecture type. Require the output flag to be specified, and output a thin binary of the specified architec‐ ture.
